intro: Hypoxis bampsiana subsp. tomentosa, commonly known as the tomentose false aloe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves covered in a dense, woolly coating. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in summer, which are clustered in a panicle-like inflorescence. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
